document_data.name: Dominate Person
document_data.patrons5e: [[Archfey patron|Archfey]], [[Great Old One patron|Great Old One]]
document_data.level5e: {{Spell table|edition=5e|[[Archfey patron|Archfey]]|5|[[Bard]]|5|[[Conquest oath|Conquest]]|5|[[Great Old One patron|Great Old One]]|5|[[Order domain|Order]]|5|[[Sorcerer]]|5|[[Trickery domain|Trickery]]|5|[[Wizard]]|5}}
document_data.Effects: Casting this spell on a person gave complete control of that person while on the same [[Plane of existence|plane]], unless the target managed to mentally resist. If successful, the caster could command the person to "move there", "attack", "fetch", ''etc.'', and the charmed person would attempt to follow his or her orders to the best of their ability. The spell could last for days if cast by a powerful spellcaster, and only those of very strong will could break the spell. The duration changed after the [[Second Sundering]] to a maximum of eight hours.
document_data.Components: Only verbal and somatic components where needed for the casting of this spell.
document_data.History:
The [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] [[Prug]] was given the credit for the creation of this spell in {{Yearlink|-1874}}. It was originally known as '''''Prug's dominate'''''.

In general only evil spellcasters used this spell. In many places, such as [[Waterdeep]], the use of this spell was illegal and considered magical assault.
